Class STVCandidate

  • java.lang.Object
    • STVCandidate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Candidate, java.lang.Comparable<STVCandidate>

    public class STVCandidate
extends java.lang.Object
implements Candidate, java.lang.Comparable<STVCandidate>

    STVCandidate

    STVCandidate - is a class that is responsible to hold the information about a candidate engaged in STV Based Voting. The class is responsible to hold information like ID, name, select status, and information about the ballots that are assigned to the candidate.
    Since:
    2018-03-13
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Team 8 (Saksham Goel - goelx029 | Kunal Munjal - munja004 | Abhishek Sairavi - saira005)

    • Field Detail

      • candidateID

        private long candidateID
        Holds the unique ID of a candidate. The ID is used to identify a candidate object. This member variable is what defines a candidate hence is required as an input parameter for the constructor.

      • candidateName

        private java.lang.String candidateName
        Holds the name of a candidate. Name of a candidate is important and is expected to be present in the first row of the input file. The candidate name is also required when constructing a candidate object hence is required as an input parameter to the constructor.

      • selected

        private boolean selected
        Holds the selected status of a candidate. Selected status determines whether a candidate is declared a winner or not.

      • candidateBallots

        private java.util.ArrayList<STVBallot> candidateBallots
        Holds all the ballots that are assigned to the candidate. The candidate to which a ballot is assigned is determined by the vote counter and then added to the candidate accordingly.

      • getNumberOfVotesEarnedByCandidate

        public int getNumberOfVotesEarnedByCandidate​()
        Description copied from interface: Candidate
        Returns the number of votes the candidate has accumulated. This is calculated by aggregating the number of ballots assigned to the particular candidate.

      • getSelectStatus

        public boolean getSelectStatus​()
        Description copied from interface: Candidate
        Returns the select status of a candidate. Select status tells whether a candidate has been declared a winner or not.

      • addBallot

        public void addBallot​(STVBallot inputBallot)
        Adds a STVBallot type object to the list of ballots for the candidate. The ballots is assigned to the candidate who is still running in the election and is the first available preference.
        Parameters:
        inputBallot - ballot that is voted for the particular candidate.

      • resetAllBallotsOfCandidate

        public void resetAllBallotsOfCandidate​()
        Resets the ballots of the candidate. Clears all the ballots that the candidate holds.

      • creditAllBallotsOfCandidate

        public void creditAllBallotsOfCandidate​()
        Mark all the ballots that the candidate has as been credited (used). This is important to mark a distinction between ballots that should not be used when the vote counter pass through ballots for another iteration. These ballots are credited only when a certain candidate is declared winner.

      • getOrderNoOfFirstBallotOfCandidate

        public int getOrderNoOfFirstBallotOfCandidate​()
        Returns the order number of the first ballot allocated to the candidate. This order number helps to resolve Tie situations in the STV based voting.
        Returns:
        int - order number of the first ballot.

      • getAllBallotsOfCandidate

        public java.util.ArrayList<STVBallot> getAllBallotsOfCandidate​()
        Returns the List of ballots that are assigned to the candidate.
        Returns:
        ArrayList{STVBallot} - Ballots associated to the candidate.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo​(STVCandidate stvCandidate)
        Overriding the compareTo function. Two candidates are compared on the basis of number of votes they have earned.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<STVCandidate>
        Returns:
        int - representing whether the current object of the candidate is less than, equal to or greater than the object passed as the parameter to the function. -1 represents current (this) object has less number of votes compared to the parameter candidate. 1 represents current (this) object has more number of votes compared to the parameter candidate. 0 represents current (this) object has equal number of votes compared to the parameter candidate.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Overriding the toString method to print meaningful information about the candidate.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String - String representation of the candidate.
